verses.roman:
eka-dina jagadānanda, svarūpa, govinda
kāśīśvara, śaṅkara, dāmodara, mukunda

samudra-snāne gelā sabe, śune katho dūre
haridāsa gāyena, yena ḍāki' kaṇṭha-svare

synonyms: eka-dina—one day; jagadānanda—Jagadānanda; svarūpa—Svarūpa; govinda—Govinda; kāśīśvara—Kāśīśvara; śaṅkara—Śaṅkara; dāmodara—Dāmodara; mukunda—Mukunda; samudra-snāne—bathing in the sea; gelā—went; sabe—all of them; śune—could hear; katho dūre—from a distant place; haridāsa gāyena—Junior Haridāsa was singing; yena—as if; ḍāki'-calling; kaṇṭha-svare—in his original voice.
translation: One day Jagadānanda, Svarūpa, Govinda, Kāśīśvara, Śaṅkara, Dāmodara and Mukunda all went to bathe in the sea. They could hear Haridāsa singing from a distant place as if calling them in his original voice.
